thread.title: Donald Trump surprises first White House tour group since he took office
thread.title_full: Donald Trump surprises first White House tour group since he took office

author: Hatty Collier
title: Donald Trump surprises first White House tour group since he took office
text:
Hugh Jackman recording Logan's berserker attack is hilarious 
Donald Trump surprised the first White House tour group since he took office by popping out from behind a partition. 
The US President appeared suddenly from behind a partition as the visitors admired Hillary Clinton’s First Lady portrait. 
His sudden appearance in the Cross Hall of the East Wing sparked loud cheers and applause from the stunned crowd. 
He beckoned the children in the crowd forward for a photograph but only one took him up on his offer – 10-year-old Jack Cornish, from Alabama. Donald Trump makes a surprise appearance in front of a tour group at the White House (REUTERS) 
Mr Trump and the child posed for photographs beneath Mrs Clinton’s portrait, which was installed in the White House in 2004, three years after her husband left office. A young girl reacts after Mr Trump makes his surprise appearance (REUTERS) 
The White House had been closed for tours since the president’s inauguration but resumed them on Tuesday. More about:
